p.seg: "King" is the more honourable designation,
"Viscount" is the humbler designation.
Refusing to use the more honourable designation and insisting on the less distinguished designation
in order to participate in the meeting of the feudal lords
is designed to
Bring along that splendid headgear!
Grand indeed is Fuchai:

before one can even get to mention the headgear he wants the headgear. Is an alternative (sardonic) reading possible?: before he is even able to properly speak about the headgear he already wants the headgear. (Then the 好冠來 would have to be translated in a more colloquial tone: get me the nice cap! to show the contrast to the 請冠 at the beginning of the comment in the context of: "Wu requested permission to the caps, garments, and mat coverings of officialdom at the Zhou capital to honour Heaven’s King." 請冠端而襲，其藉于成周，以尊天王)
Wú is a barbarian state
they cut their hair short and tatoo their bodies (in that place).
They wanted to base themselves on the rituals of Lǔ
and to rely on the power of Jìn, and they asked for official headgear and official costume, imitating things:
in borrowing from the well-established Zhōu
in order to properly venerate the King by the grace of Heaven,
Wú was making progress.
Wú is the greatest state in the eastern regions
continuously they reach out to small (surrounding) states to then convene the feudal lords
in order to keep together the central states:
and if Wú is capable of doing this
then are they bad subjects?
(No!) Wú has made progress!
